text: Brevipecten captata is a moth of the family Noctuidae first described by Arthur Gardiner Butler in 1889. ==Distribution== It is found in India, Sri Lanka, and Australia. ==Description== Its wingspan is about 3 cm. Adults are pale brown. On the forewings there are two white bordered dark patches on the costa. Hindwings are plain pale brown. ==References== Category:Moths of Asia Category:Moths described in 1889
title: Brevipecten captata
